user.biography: The most powerful stories from human history.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by History Uncovered in Japan. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Cannibal Killer Issei Sagawa Is Walking Free 一 And Plans To Eat Humans Again'.

node.text:
"The moment I saw the meat, I tore a chunk off with my fingers and threw it into my mouth. It was truly a historical moment for me."⁠
⁠
A few years after moving to Paris to study literature in 1977, 32-year-old Issei Sagawa decided to give in to his cannibalistic desires. He befriended a Dutch student named Renée Hartevelt and gained her trust. Then he shot her, defiled her corpse, and cut her up in order to eat her piece by piece over the course of several days. He claims that his only regret is that he didn't eat her while she was still alive. ⁠
⁠
Though he was arrested and sent to a Japanese mental institution, he all but avoided justice on a mere technicality and is now a free man who walks the streets of Tokyo — and talks openly about wanting to eat human flesh again.⁠
⁠
Learn more about the macabre story of Issei Sagawa by clicking the link in our profile.⁠
⁠
⁠
#truecrime #killers #cannibalism #isseisagawa #disturbing

⁠
Visit the link in our profile for more astonishing images from the Wild West reimagined in color.⁠

node.text:
Twenty years ago today, a group of six firefighters — including the father of SNL star Pete Davidson — rode the doomed Ladder 118 across the Brooklyn Bridge to get to the Twin Towers. Learn the story behind this heartwrenching photo by clicking the link in our profile.⁠
⁠

#historicalpictures #todayinhistory #ladder118 #september11 #brooklynbridge #petedavidson #historical

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by History Uncovered on September 11, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Meet The Man Who Worked For Three Years Without Pay To Build The 9/11 Victims Fund'.

node.text:
The victims killed during the September 11th attacks left behind nearly 3,000 grieving and heartbroken families. In the immediate aftermath of the devastation, Congress authorized a victim's fund to compensate each and every one of those families for their suffering and loss. And there was one man in charge of handling it all — Kenneth Feinberg. ⁠
⁠
Over the course of 33 months, Feinberg worked tirelessly to somehow calculate the monetary worth of each victim’s life and give payouts to their family members. Taking no pay for his heart-wrenching work, he assessed every claim individually and eventually distributed more than $7 billion to the families of those killed and injured during the attacks. Visit the link in our profile to read more about Kenneth Feinberg and the incredible effort to compensate families and survivors in the aftermath of September 11th.⁠
⁠
⁠
#kennethfeinberg #unsungheroes #september11 #historyuncovered #911

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by History Uncovered in Downtown Manhattan, NYC. May be an image of 1 person.

node.text:
"You just heard people screaming, stay away from the glass; stay away from the glass. You saw injured — I saw people with objects in them, burnt skulls. It was crazy compared to what I just left." ⁠
⁠
Twenty years ago today, Marcy Borders scrambled down 81 floors to flee her office in the North Tower of the World Trade Center. Though she managed to escape, the South Tower collapsed as soon as she stepped outside. Borders was immediately covered in ash and grime from head to toe, leading to her being photographed in what would become one of the most famous images from that day — click the link in our profile to read more of her story.⁠
⁠
⁠
#marcyborders #wtc #20thanniversary #911 #september11 #haunting #powerfulphotos

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by History Uncovered on September 10, 2021. May be an image of 4 people and text that says '22077 "Behind me, a filled room of 9/11 first responders, and in front of me, a nearly empty Congress. Sick and dying, they brought themselves down here to speak no one. Shameful."'.

node.text:
In 2019, Jon Stewart famously lambasted Congress for failing to ensure that the September 11th Victim Compensation Fund didn't run out of money. The former "Daily Show" host was especially furious with congresspeople who refused to show up to a hearing and listen to 9/11 first responders — some of whom were dying of cancer. ⁠
⁠
The next day, lawmakers passed the Never Forget the Heroes Act, which extended authorization for the fund through 2090. A little over a month later, the act was signed into law, finally ensuring that victims could seek the help that they needed for the rest of their lives. Click the link in our profile to learn about the health crisis of 9/11 first responders — and how the U.S. government made it worse.⁠
⁠
⁠
#jonstewart #ushistory #911 #september11 #firstresponders #sad #usgovernment #uspolitics

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by History Uncovered on September 10, 2021. May be an image of 2 people.

node.text:
Jayne Mansfield had made her starstudded career as the "naughtier Marilyn Monroe." Both women had platinum blonde hair and undeniable sex appeal, and both would die suddenly at the height of their careers.⁠
⁠
In June 1967, a car carrying Mansfield crashed into the back of a semi-truck trailer. Rumors swirled afterward that she had been decapitated when press photos revealed her blonde wig flung beside the car, but the truth was far worse. The collision had been so severe that the semi-truck sliced off the top of the car — and the top of Mansfield's head, killing her instantly.⁠
⁠
Click the link in our profile to learn the grisly fate of this Hollywood bombshell and eight more stars who met their deaths too soon.⁠
⁠
⁠
⁠
#jaynemansfield #tragicdeaths #1960s #pinups #historyuncovered

node.text:
Steve McQueen led the kind of life that a whole generation observed in awe. He was a man's man who rapidly became iconic to movie buffs and race car fanatics alike. Men wanted to be him and women couldn't help but notice him.⁠
⁠
Go inside the life of "The King Of Cool" by clicking the link in our profile.⁠
⁠
⁠
#stevemcqueen #icons #legend #kingofcool⁠ #vintage

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by History Uncovered on September 10, 2021. May be an image of 3 people and text that says 'า Before he was the head ofmodern history's most feared terrorist group, Osama Bin Laden lived the gilded lifeof a billionaire's son, went to Western-style schools, was a black belt in Judo, and married his cousin at age 17.'.

node.text:
Not only did Osama bin Laden grow up in a relatively progressive household, his family routinely went on trips to Europe and America where he developed a personal affinity for Western culture and music.⁠
⁠
Apparently, he was such a big fan of Whitney Houston that he told one of his wives that he daydreamed of murdering Bobby Brown and marrying Whitney. Go inside the strange, turbulent life of the 9/11 mastermind by clicking the link in our profile.⁠
⁠
⁠
#osamabinladen #modernhistory #facts #trivia #wtf #whitneyhouston

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by History Uncovered on September 09, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, big cat and outdoors.

node.text:
Until her sudden disappearance in the late 1950s, pinup queen Bettie Page helped spearhead the American sexual revolution. ⁠Initially a more innocent model, Page was introduced to BDSM photography in 1955 when she met Irving Klaw, a New York City-based kink photographer. Her shoots with him became so wildly popular that they drew the attention of a United States senator who launched an investigation on pornography’s impact on youth.⁠
⁠
The examination uncovered the case of a young teen who was found hanging in his bedroom and ultimately blamed models like Page for the tragedy. Shaken by the ordeal, Page disappeared from the spotlight in 1957, becoming one of the nation’s most famous recluses. In fact, Page became so secretive for so long that many were surprised to hear of her passing in 2008 — because they believed that she was already long dead.⁠
⁠
Visit the link in our profile for the full story of the historic pinup who suddenly disappeared and her life in seclusion.⁠
⁠
⁠
#bettiepage #mysteriousbettiepage #recluses #historyuncovered
